DataElement.preferredName: Person Receive Radiation Therapy Bone Marrow Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions that are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study regarding the receipt of radiation therapy and bone marrow assessments as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Receive Radiation Therapy Bone Marrow Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._To take, accept, or get something offered._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Receive Radiation Therapy Bone Marrow Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has received radia
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received radiation to the pelvis or other bone marrow-bearing sites, is bone marrow reserve considered inadequate (i.e., radiation to greater than 25% of bone marrow)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did radiation exposure exceed 30% of marrow area?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation to greater than 25% of the bone marrow?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation to more than 25% of their hematopoietically active bone marrow?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive radiation to less than or equal to 25% of the bone marrow?
